isis.stitle: REPAIR INSTRUCTIONS FOR FIBERGLASS AND PLASTIC (ABS) MATERIAL - PLASTIC (ABS) - TOOLS AND SUPPLIES

svcproc.title: TOOLS AND SUPPLIES
svcproc.para: To repair damaged ABS plastic, one or a combination of the following items will be needed:

item.para: ABS pellets-Methyl Ethyl Keytone (MEK) or Methylene Chloride (MCL).
Sikkens Autocryl Filler, Autocryl Color, Matting Clear and Auto Clear
Pneumatic or electric drill with sanding attachment, burr bits and tapered bits

warning.para: The ABS solvent cement, primers and paints are all hazardous material. Keep away from sparks and open flame. Vapors are harmful.
FIBERGLASS ABS PLASTIC REPAIRS - To avoid breathing dust and fumes, wear approved protective equipment. Breathing fiberglass ABS plastic dust and/or fumes can be hazardous to your health.

1. OSHA standards should be consulted with respect to mandatory requirements as well as suggested procedures to minimize exposure. (Reference: Title 29, Code of Federal Regulations, Section 1910, 1001.)
2. Whenever possible work on fiberglass and ABS plastics in a separate area away from other operations.
3. Always wear a respirator approved by NIOSH or MSHA during all fiberglass or ABS plastic repairs.
4. Worker clean-up. Wash your hands before eating, drinking or smoking.
